p: Comments: ‘Test wells’ refers to the wells containing enzyme + substrate and a test sample or control. Care must be taken not to create air bubbles and avoid foaming during mixing as aeration can denature the enzyme [ 98, 99]. In addition, entrapped air bubbles refract light and can therefore cause interference with absorbance measurements [ 47]. A temperature of 37 °C was chosen for all incubation steps in the α-glucosidase assay, as being close to body temperature, it is physiologically relevant and is optimal for mammalian enzyme activity [ 100].
